alert.note: Alert for Burns BLM (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 01 at 1:22PM PDT until September 02 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITIES POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST OREGON AND SOUTHWEST IDAHO FRIDAY AND SATURDAY... .An upper trough will move through the Pacific Northwest late Friday into Saturday. Gusty winds will increase across the Burns BLM on Friday with very low daytime humidities. Winds will decrease overnight before increasing and becoming more widespread on Saturday. Gusty southwest winds will spread across southeast Oregon and far southwest Idaho by mid morning Saturday before expanding across the Idaho forest zones by late morning. The strongest winds are expected at higher elevations and along ridgelines. Humidity will remain very low and critical fire weather conditions may develop on Saturday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM PDT FRIDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR BURNS BLM...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 636... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR BURNS BLM...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 636... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM PDT Friday. a Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * WINDS...15-25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6-11 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
